thread.title: Dr. Phillips Center evacuated during Harry Potter show due to alarm
thread.title_full: Dr. Phillips Center evacuated during Harry Potter show due to alarm

author: Christal Hayes
title: Dr. Phillips Center evacuated during Harry Potter show due to alarm
text:
Dr. Phillips Center evacuated during Harry Potter show due to alarm Patrons attending a show at the Dr. Phillips Center were evacuated Saturday after a fire alarm. Matthew J. Palm Patrons attending a show at the Dr. Phillips Center were evacuated Saturday after a fire alarm. Patrons attending a show at the Dr. Phillips Center were evacuated Saturday after a fire alarm. (Matthew J. Palm) Christal Hayes or Twitter: @journo_christal Caption Polk County jail worker had sex, baby with inmate 
A Polk County jail employee was arrested Thursday after having sex with an inmate that led to her giving birth to a child, officials said.

Officer Matthew Danler is charged with two counts of aggravated battery and one count of shooting into an occupied vehicle. 
Officer Matthew Danler is charged with two counts of aggravated battery and one count of shooting into an occupied vehicle. Caption Ocala man targets Target stores in explosive stock scheme 
An Ocala man stands accused making explosives, hiring a man to plant them, and attempting to blow up Target stores along the east coast -- all so that he could buy Target stock at lower prices. 
An Ocala man stands accused making explosives, hiring a man to plant them, and attempting to blow up Target stores along the east coast -- all so that he could buy Target stock at lower prices. Caption Markeith Loyd indicted on two first-degree murder charges 
A grand jury on Wednesday indicted Markeith Loyd in two first-degree murder cases, Ninth Circuit State Attorney Aramis Ayala announced. 
A grand jury on Wednesday indicted Markeith Loyd in two first-degree murder cases, Ninth Circuit State Attorney Aramis Ayala announced. Caption Man steals shotgun and Nikes, still can't outrun deputies - True Crime 
After stealing jewelry, a shotgun, and a pair of Nikes, a a 22-time felon attempts to hold up traffic before deputies apprehend him in the woods.
